Package main

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
main.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment extends Object
This class implements key aspects of the game functionality, and keeps track of metrics such as score, game length and current day. This class also contains functions to create instances of certain classes, such as Warriors and items, and for the former, stores the base stats of these consequently. Functionality is also implemented related to validity of strings and other end of day functions.
Author:
Callum Hampton, Geordie Gibson

    endDay(Player player, GameEnvironment game, Store store, BattleHub battleHub)
    Implements the events that should take place when the day has ended and a new day is starting, including random overnight events (Warriors can leave, join, or level up).Also calls relevant functions for resetting/re-randomizing the game state for the next day.

    • endDay

      public String endDay(Player player, GameEnvironment game, Store store, BattleHub battleHub)
      Implements the events that should take place when the day has ended and a new day is starting, including random overnight events (Warriors can leave, join, or level up).Also calls relevant functions for resetting/re-randomizing the game state for the next day.
      Parameters:
      player - Player of game
      game - Game Environment instance
      store - Store instance
      battleHub - BattleHub instance
      Returns:
      The message that should be displayed to the user depending on what happened overnight
